title: Business Grants and Financial Support Data

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 regarding business grants and financial support provided by the council. Please could you provide the following information for the financial years 2020/21, 2021/22, 2022/23, and 2023/24:
- The total number of business grants awarded each year.
- The total value (£) of business grants awarded each year.
- A breakdown of each type of business grant awarded, including:
-The name of the grant scheme.
-The number of grants awarded under each scheme.
-The total value (£) awarded for each scheme.
-The total value (£) of business grants identified as overpayments each year.
- If available, the number of grants awarded by industry sector.
"Business grants" refer to financial support provided to businesses directly by the council or through government-funded schemes administered locally.
If tracking industry sectors or grant types is not feasible within cost limits, please provide the aggregate totals and indicate where data is unavailable.
If any data exceeds the FOI cost limits, please contact me so that I can refine the request accordingly.
If you require further clarification on any part of this request,  please let me know.
All the best,
Jamie Dixon

Dear Jamie Dixon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Business Grants
which we received on 14/01/2025.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
In regards to your first two questions, please see the following link:
[1]Council spend over £250 | Data Mill North Council monthly expenditure
is published here. You can filter by Directorate (City Futures) and Object
Code Description (Grants).
The spend data filtered to City Futures would include all supplies and
services spend paid to businesses and whilst some are grants, there is no
way to determine whether other titles are grants or not.
Please see especially published Grants 2020-22:
[2]
https://datamillnorth.org/download/emd0m...
The published grants for 2020-22 provides most of the grant titles but we
note that there are some that relate to planning and recovered costs, so
do not fall within the scope of your request. We do not think that this is
a complete list. Grants to businesses are not the preserve of our Business
Growth and Development service.
We have a number of grant schemes across the council.
The information you have requested is exempt from disclosure under section
12 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000. Sheffield City Council does
hold the information you have requested. However, we do not record the
information in a format that allows us to produce an electronic report of
this. Therefore, we would have to carry out a manual search of our
records. it would take us more than the cost limit of 18 hours or £450
specified in the [3]Freedom of Information and Data Protection
(Appropriate Limit and Fees) Regulations 2004 (SI 2004 No. 3244).
Under section 16 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000, we have a duty to
provide advice and assistance to requesters. If you would like to narrow
down the focus of your request to be more specific or targeted at
particular schemes, we would be happy to process your revised request as a
new request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [4]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[5]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
